data.text: not bad. fun distracting time killer. Update: Changing from four to two stars. Well, after four days, not so much fun now. After only about 10 levels it's getting exponentially difficult to the point I cannot advance. Uninstalling rather than waste more time on a futal effort. A sheer genius might be able to keep playing, but that's a very tiny group, and they probably aren't wasting time playing games.

Decent time killer. It's pretty simple, match the tiles of the same color to remove a spot and to win the game. I like the fact that there are minimal ads, but you can watch ads to win rewards instead of using coins. Speaking of which, coins seem to be easy to use up and perhaps a little harder to gain. I only gave 4 stars because even though I know I haven't gotten to hard levels yet, I think there should be more challenging levels.

A fun game absolutely destroyed by invasive ads. Put ads between the levels, fine. But to have ads without any way to turn off their volume, or ads that jump you to the Play Store every time you try to close them, it's beyond infuriating, it's insulting. It's forcing the player's hand. Give me an ad. Make me watch it for 5, 10, even 15 seconds. But do not give an ad that forces open the store three times in a row before it even gives you the option to close it. Worst ad algorithm I've ever seen.

Excellent game, extremely entertaining, and easy to pick up. I would give it 5 stars but I have one issue with it. The cost for removing ads is $7.99 which is pretty steep. I went ahead and paid it because I love this game and want to be able to play it more on my breaks. The $7.99 ad removal only removes the ads that pop up at the start of each level. It does not remove the ads that you have to watch to open up the free spaces or power ups. For $7.99 it should remove all ads, not just some.
data.replyText: Hey Chase, your feedback regarding the No-Ads item pricing has been forwarded to the team. Please allow us to explain that the rewarded videos are kept, in order to facilitate our players to earn numerous gifts and rewards, which also is a standard practice to balance the gift economy for the game.

data.text: Not as difficult as some people are making it out to be - challenging at times but definitely fair. Simple to play game that doesn't feel like it was made for a 2yr old. Don't mind the ads too much because they're in between levels but it getting kinda annoying when they're long and unskippable. Still better than most free to play games out there now.

This game is just a vehicle to deliver the most advertisements possible. With that said, the gameplay is pretty fun and enjoyable. It has really helped kill a lot of downtime. The ads you have to watch are quite long and some will not end unless you participate in a gameplay. (If I wanted to play Township, I'd play Township. However, I'm not playing Township, so stop making me play Township when I don't want to.) Further, there are a couple of ads that glitch and don't end.

Decent puzzle game. Concept is simple. Stack matching colors to score points. Ads are minimal. However once you hit the later levels, the game intentionally starts giving you everything but the colors you need to complete your runs. Went 7 draws without seeing a single yellow and then got one on the bottom of a stack of that couldn't even get played to a matching color. This requires you to either burn through your power ups or watch ads to unlock tiles and use power ups. Had so much potential

First, is it like the ad? No. The ad imply the levels are bigger. In real game all the levels are same size, and after the first 100 levels you notice they are recycling them. That's okay though. It's still nice game. What isn't good is sometimes U opt 2 watch an ad and it bugs out and U don't get the item. Also, sometimes U opt to see an ad and U have to watch 2 ads in a row. That's way2 much. Some ads are so long requiring u to click x 2 or 3 times. X is microscopic, cause store open

Just started playing this game & the game is fun & relaxing. I'm already ready to uninstall it however because of the ads. I'm ok with ads, as long as they aren't every few minutes. The thing is, when I want to press X to leave an ad, instead of leaving it takes me on to the play store to install whatever game the ad is advertising and won't let me return to Hexa Sort. This happens Every Single Time without fail. So I have to close the app and reopen it every time an ad pops up. No thanks.

No, just no. It's a fun time killer and I really enjoyed the concept but the ads killed it for me. $10 to remove them. Worth $5 at most in my opinion. Turned the volume off in the menu, there's still sound, you respond to a text for five seconds go back to the game LOOK two ads, in the middle of playing after less than a minute LOOK two more ads without warning at full volume! Just not worth the frustration with how intrusive and annoying the ads are.

I LOVE this game! It's fun, challenging, and really enjoyable. It would definitely be 5 stars if it wasn't for the ads blasting music so you have to turn sound off, not just for the game, which is too bad because I like the game sounds, but for your phone, too, because it's not just music, it's horribly annoying music. Way to ruin a great game through greed.

It was entertaining until the gamme starts purposely sabatoging your ability to win. After a certain level they just refuse to give you colors you can use and force you you use up lives. And the ads are horribly placed. They play before you restart a round but half the time they have no exit button for 2 minutes and then take you to another page and when you come back it's taken the life but not restarted the level.

I paid to remove ads, and there are still ads! For the game only, this is 5 stars! Interesting, makes you think but not too hard. However, there are ads everywhere. I like the game enough to pay to remove the ads, but there are still ads you have to watch to use pieces of the board! Total rip off!! The game was too expensive for the price, especially because it only gets rid of half of the ads! So deceitful and no way to treat your supporting customers. So disappointing! Rip off!!!

If you have seen the (many, many) advertisements on the apps you play, then you already know how the game goes. What you should know before downloading is that this game will inundate you with even more ads. Not just between levels, and not just when you exit the app and return, but sometimes while you are midgame, it will pop up an ad. The ads are definitely why I am deleting this game. Gameplay is a bit fun, but a lot like many other games on Play Store.

Changing rating from 5 to 2 star. The gameplay is great and addictive. Love the addition of items to be broken etc as you progress keeping it interesting and challenging but still achievable. However, the banner ads at the bottom of screen are loud and obnoxious (even with sounds turned off in game settings). Also some of the full screen ads after completing levels are getting very inappropriate. The ads are allowed by app not google store. Poor taste on an app for "everyone".

There is NO option to replay the level without having to watch an ad, AND there's no option to go back to the main screen without having to exit out of the app.The game promises that you wouldn't lose a life if you pressed the replay button and watched an ad, however I found that you still lose a life regardless if you watch the ad or not. What a scam.

I loved this game. I had planned on purchasing no ads to support the devs... until the gameplay changed. It was fine having locked tiles, but now the goals are that of an every day boring match 3 game. Break the ice, break the boards. I'd much rather have the old gameplay back with an endless mode. Bad move on their part. Breaks my heart to install it.

I amended my original review from four stars to two. After paying $8 to remove ads they're still embedded video ads and microtransactions to refill lives. I've paid less for AAA games that still didn't include microtransactions. The game is fun, but I feel deceived & cheated. When I pay for a game I expect to be able to play it at will, not run out of lives and be asked to pay extra money or wait 20 minutes like I didn't pay for it. I consider that a lie. Might dispute the charge.

Great when it works, but it's buggy. It frequently freezes and crashes, taking everything else with it, even my wallpaper. Fun game and a reasonable number of ads, just isn't great that it stops responding and crashes my whole phone. This also happened on my tablet. I like it but I might have to uninstall if the freezing keeps up.

Free squares still don't work and ads are now over a minute long and unskippable and have no progress bar of any kind. I don't care so much about ads (and won't be spending $8 to get rid of them) but every ad being over 60 seconds and unskippable is just not acceptable. Ads for boosters are 2-3 minutes long. The game is fun, truly, but this is ridiculous.

If I base my review on the actual game challenge it would be a higher score but due to all the bugs the lower score. I shouldn't have to tap the free move a 1000 times for it to notice. Then when you do finally get it to recognize and you watch the video for free move it shows a second video and says ad break, then you have to tap the free button 1000 times again to watch a 3rd video to get free move.

Itbwas fun in the beginning. Very addictive. Then they intentionally give puzzles that you really can't solve without watching multiple 30 ads for tiktok sometimes one right after another. It can get up to 4 minutes of the same tiktok ad. It's so obnoxious. I'd like to find a game like this from different developers.

Went from 4 stars to 1. SO many long, long ads for that #@!* "royal match" game! I just got 2, back to back, after playing 1 fast game. FOUR MINUTES of 2 ads with no "X". It just played making you watch TheFinger play the game. No way to exit. Goes to Play Store. "FREE" squares for watching an ad don't work so by level 18 you're playing half-boards and lose. $7.99 for ad-free is ridiculous! Multi-player games are cheaper. Such a fun game..such a shame greed and buggy UI ruined it.

I cannot go on enough about how much I love and appreciate the color blind setting, so many apps would be so much more accessible with a simple little toggle option like this game has 💚 Pretty minimal ads, and it seems like when it forces an ad you get a small reward for having to watch it! I've played almost nonstop for a week now and I love it, I hope this game doesn't get bogged down with ads and pay walls in the future. You've done great dev team, your time and effort is appreciated!💚💚💚

Overall it's a simple time killer. Play is simple enough if you can reason through basic patterns. I haven't found anything that requires you to spend real money on and the adds are limited. Kudos to the devs for getting that right. The reason for a one star rating is the bugs. Every week you're given a list of quests to complete for a prize. For three consecutive weeks, one of the quests has been impossible to complete because the counter resets every day, ensuring you can't win.
data.replyText: Hey Dawn, we sincerely apologise for your experience. These issues have been fixed in the latest update. We request you to please update your game to the latest app version available on the store without deleting the app. Please feel free to contact us in case of any other issues and we will be happy to assist you.

data.text: I like this game... a lot! It's really a cool game! What I don't like, however, is the "watch ads for rewards" things that DON'T WORK. I just watched 8 ads trying to use the "hammer" and it still hasn't let me do it. It worked once yesterday, first time in over a week, so I thought there was hope, but no. It's still broken.. and today also... Frustrating as hell! I need that hammer to work so I can get past this level! Ad watching with no reward is LAME, guys. FIX IT

Lame. After about Level 6, each time you finish a level you have to watch an obnoxious ad. Half the board is locked behind ads or you can pay coins that take multiple levels to collect. Then each building takes more and more "hexes", so you have to do multiple levels just to complete one building. It starts off fun and easy to suck you in, then the dev's greediness starts to show. I understand wanting to make money, but this is just ridiculous.

Really fun game. It needs explanation of how it chooses which way to flip. Also a colorblind mode would be useful. The gameplay is really solid but sometimes you get into a situation where you have 3 empty spaces and 3 stacks and no moves. I think the gameplay would be better if it gave you a new stack every time you placed one so you always have 3. Update: it does have colorblind mode. Wish it was high contrast but appreciate it. New stack doesn't always pull though. There are exceptions.
data.replyText: Hey Stuart, we are glad to inform you that we have a colorblind mode integrated (you can turn this mode on by navigating to the settings panel, found on the top right corner of the screen). Additionally, the latest stack/tiles you had placed on the board will pull the current tile stack you are placing. This is how the hexa tiles merge.

data.text: Game advertises itself as something you can play in airplane mode but still requires you to watch ads to get lives or even unlock parts of a level's board. I don't like liars. Also, fun fact, oftentimes the game will break during the ad process and will take two hearts from you when you restart a level. Super scummy. I get that you want money, it's a business, but for god's sake, please TRY to be decent about it!

Made it to lvl 94 before quitting This game was a LOT of fun. But the ads really are too much. It's around $7 for ad free. Too much to me. Anyway, at level 94, the ads started interrupting *While* playing. Not when i needed to revive or use a life, randomly in game. 😡 I also feel i shouldn't have to watch an ad just to play or to use my lives while in game. This game is more like "watch ads to try a puzzle!" It gets worse the more you play. & Reward system is poorly desifned too.

So far, so good. Lots of gameplay, minimal intrusive ads--but it's early days yet. The object seems to be to acquire X number of tiles during a round w/o running out of empty spots. Tiles are cleared and counted when a stack's at least 10 tiles high. Main complaint is that the way the stacks flip SEEMS to be random, which makes strategy kind of impossible. There are no instructions in the app. Would be a solid 4-star game if there was a clear way to predict stack flip in order to plan ahead.

It's sad, because the game is fun. It's slightly confusing how the game decides where to flip the tiles to and from, but it's still fun. I'd probably give it 3 or 4 stars, except that it has forced ad breaks. Ad driven bonuses and a permanent banner ad while playing aren't enough. Every few levels, you're forced to watch an ad, unless you pay to remove these ads. Optional ads are one thing. Forced ad breaks are a deal breaker. Do better, and lose the greed.

This game is actually fun! I wish some levels were bigger and took longer to complete, but otherwise it's a pretty good balance between fun and challenging. You don't need to spend any real money, and there are plenty of opportunities to get coins, like quests, races, leagues, and spins. Once you spin 100 and figure out some game strategies, you're pretty much set and never need to watch another long ad, though there are still automatic ads that can be skipped after a few seconds.

Been playing for a while now. Very fun game with minimal ads. But, with the recent update, the goal of the game changed to breaking boards, or ice blocks rather than accumulating a set number of tiles to beat the level and I now find it to be not as challenging. Update: Good mix of goals during the levels, multiple goals per stage. Still very much addicted.

Played a full, inescapable ad upon completion of a level, which it has never done before. This game has been better for ads as a whole because they only randomly pop up for 3 to 5 seconds, easy to get out of. Suddenly finishing a level only to be forced into a 45 second ad with no way out? (Believe me, I tried). Really disappointing.

I like the game itself. Its satisfying to clear the board and it looks nice and the ads aren't too bad. My only complaints are that I wish I could tell better where the stacks will go, as of now I don't see any reason for the direction, and I REALLY wish there was a free play or endless mode. It really ruins the game for me when I'm getting into it and it rips me out because I finished the level. It's frustrating

Used to love playing this game. Not a lot of heavy strategy but some. With this latest update, not so much fun. The number of hexes needed to dissolve the stack is greater, and the points to unlock the spaces are increased. Make it more challenging? Yes, great. Make it impossible to win each round without spending cash? No thanks. Uninstall.

It's engaging for the most part. The boards aren't that difficult, and that's one of the biggest problems along with the low coin earning to high spending ratio. With no idea when the next update is, it's pointless and boring to keep playing the same board repeatedly. Now, it's just taking up space I could use for better executed games.

I loved this game but the ads killed it. You can pay the $8, but you still need to watch ads. Some ads at the end round are ok but they get worse as you go. If you want to watch an ad to free up another space, brace yourself for a 2 minute ad (2 ad spaced per board). This is from the developers - Ads Bundle only removes the bottom banner ads and inters. It does not remove Ads that give you extra rewards. The rewarded ads help us maintain a balanced prize system. WHAT A JOKE!

It's got potential. After level 20, it's almost impossible to pass the level even with multiple attempts. I'm currently stuck at 25, which I've been stuck on for a week because the tiles available are impossible to color coordinate with the stacks given, if that makes any sense.

it's a nice time waster to keep the intrusive thoughts away. the leaderboard is fake and it's easy to tell while you're playing. I appreciate the change to where you can continuously revive, bc some level designs are impossible without it. needs option for lower quality graphics that don't drain your battery as fast or overheat your device

I don't usually leave reviews, but after completing over 100 levels in a few days, I feel inclined to. This game is addictive, but the difficulty fluxates SO MUCH. Some levels are mind numbingly easy where I can basically close my eyes and win, while other feel like if you make a SINGLE sub-par move, you'll fail. Luckily, rewards are very easy to come by, and you can use them often. Overall, I like this game alot but I really wish they would add the option for an endless mode without ice/planks.

Amazing game! Also, there' s barely any ads, at least for me. Heres a brief explanation; you get different colored blocks to match colors, get to the certain score given at the beginning by matching the colors and you have 5 lives you lose one if you incomplete the goal.

The game is a lot of fun and challenging, but when the game starts, the adds aren't bad they are short and not too often, but the higher the levels you go, the more adds you start to see and they become more than 60 second adds. It's to bad cus it's a fun game. Uninstall

I have been playing for a while and don't even mind the ads. My issue is leagues are rigged. My wife and I both play and are in seperate leagues. I will be leading a league for days then all the sudden Leonardo, Legendary, and Parker are double my trophies... which would be fine, except looking at my wife's league all 3 players are in the same spot with the same exact trophy count that doesn't change. This is deceitful.

Paid to have the ads removed. Worked for a while then started to get ads every other game. Contacted customer service who said paying to have ads removed only stopped the ads that occurred in the middle of a game and I needed to hit the restore purchase button to correct it, did not work. Contacted customer service again,got the same answer. Still getting ads in the middle of games. Contacted customer service again. They want me to take screen shots of the ads. No. I paid They need to fix

Too little control A great concept ruined by being adware nonsense. If you controlled which direction stacks flipped and maybe also when full stacks disappeared (since you can overload them), you might be able to not lose so long as you had sufficient skill. But then you wouldn't watch ads for extra blank spaces, revive, clear stack, etc. So the game controls everything but where you put the new stacks it dealt you and plays dumber the longer it's been since you watched an ad.

Starts fun This game starts fun but around level 20 you have to start spending coins to get through the game. I am on 20 right now and have tried 30 times to pass this level only to get a little over halfway and the colors start to stacking the opposite way they were the entire level. That's not to mention different colors coming in that are useless and color combinations that you haven't had the whole time and now have to make work. I will be deleting this game.

I liked it at first. Then I got to level 25 and just cannot beat it. I'll think I've got the hang of it then the tiles will stack where I wasn't expecting or I'll have 5 available slots and all 3 of my options are colors I haven't gotten yet which forces me to fill up spaces and ultimately lose the game within minutes of starting it. Drains my battery, overheats my phone, and the only reason it got 2 stars is because the ads aren't AS aggressive/invasive as other games I've played.

I'm enjoying game play, and the ads are at least not interrupting play, unlike some other games I've tried. I'm just annoyed that when I click the x at the end of the game, it never takes me back to the main page. Also, when I joined the race it said "click to continue" but no matter where I click nothing happens. Cool.

Updated, after trying to play again I realized that this game is designed to make you lose. You don't get any power ups to help very much. You get like 2 coins after every level and the power ups cost 10,25 and 50. There are boards you can not win without using the power ups and I'm pretty sure if you buy the ad free you will still have to watch to get extra board spaces and power ups which is false advertising cause ad free means AD FREE. Honestly this game was enjoyable but not anymore

Pretty fun. However, once you reach a certain level of play, the difficulty of the levels begins to level out. I am at approx level 278 and for the last 100 levels or so has been about the same. I wish the challenge of each level would increase after so many levels. Otherwise it just becomes repetitive and boring....

One problem I'm having is the game will freeze after playing it,don't know duration of play when it freezes up. And can't even close out app, error message doesn't come up like on other apps.. phone will close out game after 15 minutes of being froze up. That being said I still like the game it's addictive

Fair review coming in. The gameplay of this game is actually really, really good. Great job to the folks that built the game 👍🏻 Here's where the issue comes in. I paid the 8.99 (!!!!!) To remove the ads. And the amount of ads you STILL have to endure to enjoy the game properly is completely unreasonable and honestly, feels borderline harassment. Some ads don't show timers. Some ads take upwards of 2 minutes, with no timers on screen (redundant, I know). It's sick, really.
data.replyText: Hey Erik, we sincerely apologise about your experience. Please note that the Remove Ads Bundle only removes the bottom banner ads and inters. It does not remove Ads that give you extra rewards. The rewarded ads help us maintain a balanced prize system where our players can watch Ads for increased rewards.

data.text: Several Bugs with little response from support. Progress on one of the levels kept resetting, tasks weren't acknowledging completion and I lost several competitions due to various bugs. Right now, I'm only 1 task away from completing the week tasks and have gotten 0 credit despite having completed it several times over now. I asked about receiving credit back for the issues but have gotten no response.

Starts out fun ends up impossible. With the lack of spaces, colors that don't match anything you have, and random flip it gets nearly impossible to win without power ups and tons of ads. In the middle of playing you get a random "ad break". Uninstalled. It could have been great but it's set to make you watch ads.

Not sure how I feel about this game. On the one hand it's a great concept, but on the other, I have way to control which direction the tiles go, and no information telling me which way they will go. That and the random "ad breaks" and pushed ads just push me away from playing, meaning less ad revenue for the game publishers.

Pros: It plays as advertised with a surprising skill curve with a cute world reveal mechanic at the home screen. Cons: Within 15 minutes of downloading and playing it has used 8% of my newer Google Pixel's battery and caused the phone to grow physically almost hot through my otterbox case. Unsure as to what coding error is making it overheat as similar games have never done this. The only other game to do this was Honkai Star Rail which also runs on PCs and has high graphic processing needs.
data.replyText: We sincerely apologise for this and would like to assure you that we are actively working to optimise the game in order to resolve the device heat up problem. We are aware of the resolution urgency for this problem and will be sending out an update very soon.

data.text: So I really like this game.. BUT, I have been playing and beating the boards only to be stuck and no matter how many times I beat the board the level does not change.. it just keeps filling the same thing over and over.. this is quite frustrating especially since I do really love the game please fix it.

Really enjoy the game but it's way too unstable. Can make it thru maybe 1½ levels before the game freezes and you have to shut it down and restart. Sometimes after waiting for the game to reload it drops you into the game you lost.... Sometimes not. Spend more time rebooting the game than playing

This game says nothing about having ads, but it has a bunch of ads. And to get rid of ads it cost $7.99. So why didn't they just sell it for that price instead of leading me to believe that it was free. This is another one of those ads app. All free apps anymore have ads. I've even bought apps from the app store and they still had ads. If you want the truth, I say play Nintendo Switch instead.

The game is a fun time killer, but it started downloading other games via the app that I didn't give permission to do it. This has to be against the rules of the Play Store. For all I know, these games could have malware on it. This game needs to be taken down until they get rid of that. Also, when I turn off the screen and do something and come back. It goes into another ad break. This is just stupid. I'm uninstalling.

It WAS good, but the update made it terrible: it lags and freezes during gameplay now, and I hate the layout now. It WAS a simple, fun game. Now it looks like one of those cheap games that steals your data. I don't want to hold the button to build the scene. I don't want to collect coins and fill a piggy bank for some pointless achievement. I just want to play the game and sort the tiles. I'm really sorry I updated this game.

Bought the no ads. There are still ads. interesting game, though. Edit 1: Clearly, but that wasn't specified. I've seen both kinds of no ads before. The fact that you still have to watch ads is ridiculous even if it is made clear before the purchase. Maybe it did specify, but it wasn't clear enough. Thanks for the response. Edit 2: Thanks for looking into improving the clarity.
data.replyText: Hey Brian, we understand your reservation regarding the clarity of content offered through this purchase, we shall make the UI improvements in the game for clear communication about bundles. We highly appreciate your feedback.

data.text: so far, enjoyable game light level of problem solving with very minimal ads that are not disruptive or invasive. Game gets very repetitive with little variation at higher levels. There's a lot that's random in the game, what order you get colors in and some extent which side colors will flip to when adding a hexa of a matching color. Still nice enough for a light distraction. I ran into issues, though, with it running up the temperature of my phone, Google Pixel 6 pro.
data.replyText: Hey Kimberly, thank you for your valuable feedback. We’re constantly trying to improve the game experience for you guys. We've forwarded your suggestions and concerns to our dev team. We are also going to release all new levels, very soon. Please stick around.

data.text: People really need to learn to review better. 4.4 is way too high. These games are designed to create a problem and then sell you the solution. I'm at lvl 18 and the game by design is now adding more colors than can mathematically be played with the slots given. LEVEL 18... not like 50 or 100 to build interest. On top of that I should be able to choose which tiles flip - the game makes some awful decisions as to where it moves, adding complete randomness on top of blind pulls.

Fun little game to work my brain. The coin system is relatively well balanced and the graphics are pleasantly colorful. My only complaint is the constant reminder to turn on notifications. I've been playing this game for about a month now, if I wanted notifications, they'd be on. Please fix it so it stops hounding me after ever game!
data.replyText: Hey Bek, we apologise that you keep encountering this issue. We have forwarded your concern to the dev team and are working to fix this for you. Please stick around for the next update.

data.text: This game would be amazing if it worked properly. It has the option to open up hex spot with an ad, BUT matter no how many ads I watch, it doesn't open. It gives the option to watch an ad to "revive" if I run out of room, BUT AGAIN the ad does nothing! Please fix this so I don't have to uninstall the game because I actually like playing it. I got yesterday's update (1/3/2023) and the ads DO NOT work. Still not working properly, I uninstalled because of this.
data.replyText: Hey Important, we would request you to please update your game to the latest version from the Store, as we have made improvements for a better gameplay experience. We would love for you to stay around, and please let us know if we can assist you in any way.

data.text: I keep trying to play this game because it is a fun challenge but the game is so glitchy and does not work properly. Lots of ads and most don't even work or give you the reward. I click on spaces with the 'free video' to free up that space and the video link does not work. I end up clicking over & over again. Then it plays a video & freezes on a black screen and I have to close the game and lose my progress. It's very frustrating. There are other sorting games without all these issues.

The game itself is fun. It's easy to grasp the rules and it's not timed, so it's a fun game to play when you just want to zone out for a bit. The problem is that it crashes a bit. The initial lower levels were fine but when I got closer to level 15 it started freezing but would usually unfreeze quickly. Now I'm level 21 and have had it crash multiple times and it doesn't save your progress so you have to start that round over again no matter how close you were to finishing it.
data.replyText: Hey Ambrosia, we're extremely sorry that you have been facing app crashes, but rest assured, our dev team is working to fix this for you. Please stick around, the next update shall be released soon. We highly appreciate your feedback :)

data.text: Edit: The new update is horrible. Dropped from 5 to 3 stars, for now. Literally can not beat this level. My whole first review doesn't even apply anymore. Did fix some glitches though. 1st review -I feel like this game wants people to win. It seems to help when your struggling. I'm really enjoying the simplicity, but challenging at the same time.
data.replyText: Hey Misty, we're so glad to hear that you enjoy the game and deeply appreciate your continued support. Thank you so much!

data.text: I really want to like this game, its challenging and fun.. Has one major flaw for me. Gives you the option to aquire extra points by watching ads. So you watch the ad but never get the points. The game is challenging enough that not being able to get the extra points will be a game killer for me. Will most likely uninstall eventually.

I enjoy the game but at the end of every round is an ad, I have to watch before I can even decide to watch an ad for x2. I don't mind ads but seriously there is a point where they are absurd. Regretfully I'll probably be deleting because of this, I'm not going to watch an add just to watch another 2 to double 5 coins. And it's always 2 ads per boost too, ugh

The game is great. The only reason why I'm giving it one star and uninstalling is because ads AUTOMATICALLY download apps to your phone WITHOUT your authorization or without clicking download on the app store. After touching the X to close the ad, it downloads the app for the game on the ad. That's so SNEAKY! I've never seen anything like that from any other game with those stupid excessive ads. I'm surprise Google even allows it! I'm sure that is breaking multiple user privacy rules.

It's a really good concept and the minimal ads are amazing, but it's too luck-dependent. I think there should always be 3 tiles to choose from instead of clearing all 3 before getting new ones. Sometimes I just have to guess which color will come up next, which doesn't make it much of a puzzle. It has a lot of potential though!

I would give it 5 stars but it takes a lot of taps to get the free space to open. I have also played all the levels so we need more. ALSO, after you finally get it to work it gives an ad break instead, sometimes many in a row. I just got 3 in a row instead of it opening the free slot.
data.replyText: Hey K "Lookythar, We’re so sorry about your experience, we will definitely look into this. We will be releasing all new & awesome levels for you guys very soon. Please stick around :)

data.text: Enjoyable game. I'd enjoy the puzzle aspect alot more if which way tiles flipped wasn't random. Instead of thinking through I just have to take a guess and hope I get lucky. And higher levels don't add variety, if anything it seems like it's the same boards just rigged against you.
data.replyText: Hey M, thank you for sharing your valuable suggestions. We've forwarded your feedback to the dev team. You'll be glad to know that we will be releasing all new puzzles for you guys, very soon. Please stick around!

data.text: Great game but I'm at level 87 and there are no more cities/scenes to complete after London. I can still play but I don't make any progress. If there are more scenes to complete added I'll keep playing. Minimal glitching, ads are annoying but tolerable. Lack of levels to complete are the only reason I didn't give 5 stars
data.replyText: Hey April, we highly appreciate your feedback. Please hang in there for just a bit more, we are going to release the new worlds very soon.

data.text: It's ok until above level 20 or so. You cant control which direction the blocks move so it really limits the board when you need to place blocks in a specific order but the blocks merge into the opposite spot not letting you place your next block. Pretty much impossible unless you spend money to buy coins to use hammers, swaps and removes which IMO isn't the way a puzzle game was intended to be solved.

Really like this game and the ads are only as options for rewards- that's it. Should be perfect but there's too many glitches. Like ads not available when you need them, ads going to black screen and not taking you back to the game, game freezing, etc. Had to uninstall. So sad.

Great game, but battery killer. I was pretty hooked and enjoying it regularly but noticed my phone was draining quite quickly. I'm used to only plugging in once every day or two. With this I seemed to need to keep my phone plugged in, even when I wasn't playing it. Changed some settings, no improvement. Checked my battery settings too. Discovered the app was using 82% of my battery. 25% in the background How is that even possible? I had to remove it in the end.

It's fun and addicting! Just passed through 300 levels. The ads never really bothered me much, I've had worse. The only time I got annoyed was trying to answer texts and Every time I switched screens and switched back I'd have to watch another ad. But the things that really bug me the most are the leaderboard bots - I agree that there's no reason for a leaderboard if it's all just bots. Also, I'd kill for an endless mode - it's all repetitive after awhile and I want what the ads show.

[Edit: a lot more ads now unforunately, so I'm removing 2 stars, and I feel like the leader board is a lie??? It's always the exact same 3 people in the top 3 and their order never changes. Why not just make a real leader board? Would be so much more fun.] One of the few games with barely any ads! Super fun game, relaxing and very satisfying! Thank you!

Okay so the thing is I like the game. The game is one of those 'I don't need to think about what I'm doing to play' kind of games. Couple of gripes with a few bugs. When I run out of lives I press the cross and its a loop that doesn't return to the home screen, enter an ad and then when an ad finishes it doesn't open the next level it's just a black screen. My main gripe I have is the 'leader board' which is only bots. What is the point in having a fake leader board there's no competition then!

Like many people, I'm in love with the game concept. I'm not so in love with aspects of the execution. There are a lot of ads to watch if you want the full experience. Want an extra space in the game? Watch an ad. Run out of lives? Watch an ad. Want the daily bonuses? Watch an ad. The biggest problem with these 'optional' ads is that even if you pay the very pricey amount they want for you to have no ads, you still have to watch the optional ads for extras. No ads just stops the ad breaks.

I like the game (I'm over 440 levels at this moment) but now the rewards ads are not working. I watch the ad and still can't revive/unlock spaces when needed, this is why I'm rating 3 stars (will change if it's fixed). Also I agree that the remove ads price is pretty high in Brazilian Real, I think this could be localized to reflect the reality of our economy. And I agree to other comments asking for endless mode, this would be amazing.

A simple puzzle idea that's fun and challenging. I'm over lvl 100 and have found ads non-intrusive, usually just for rewards, plenty of power ups, though most levels I've completed without needing them. Probably my favourite feature is that you can keep stacking hexes during the animation. This means if you can be fast enough, you can get lots of mega stacks which is actually easier than waiting for the best pieces.

I love this game, but the daily and stage rewards are too small for the effort. It's frustrating to receive such meager rewards after completing challenging stages. Despite this, I still enjoy the engaging gameplay and captivating story. I hope the developers consider adjusting the rewards system for a more satisfying experience.

Been playing a bit now and really enjoy the game, Im over level 200. There are ads but they are here and there and if you want some items to help you through levels. My only feedback is sometimes I watch an ad for an item or a revive and the game crashes after the ad so I have to restart it and I end up losing the item/revive which is kind of annoying after I just watched the ad for no reason.

Ok, sorting, but this is lacking serious rules and logic. I have no idea what stack travels where or when it dissapears, or how many pieces stack can hold or is holding currently. I'm just randomly placing mixed stacks matching top or mid colors, and hope for the solve. And then the ads.. It's not worth the money it asks for ads removal. Great potential, but needs better realisation.

Fun and addictive game but ads are a bit excessive. They come on every single time you finish a level, even sometimes mid game too. It wouldn't be so bad if the adverts didn't automatically take you to the play store, making you have to manually exit out of that and back into the game. Quite excessive that and it grates quite a bit, limiting game time.

Frustrating to say the least, starts out a lot of fun, then it starts getting challenging, very nice function were you can continue playing by running short ads, but this is where the frustration starts, the adds trick you into opening a link, once you press a wrong button your game closes to open that link, then you need to reload the game to the point before the add playd, and so it carries on, till I got to my senses and uninstalled this game

Was a fan at the start, and then I caught the pattern. Ads increased in frequency. And the tiles intentionally jump in the least logical direction which forces you to lose. You should make it player controlled which direction it jumps because forcing a loss to push your ads is frustrating and is making me and others uninstall.

The amount of ads are ridiculous. I paid for no ads and apparently (unlike all other paid games) they only eliminate the constant ads. If you choose to use a free space... ad... if you use a revive.... ad. On top of that the way in which the tiles move makes no sense. Seems either random at best or worse to intentionally to block best option to force you into watching more ads.

Love this game, hate the ads. 4/ 5 stars because there are too many ads. My objection is that its almost kmposfibld to pass levels if I dont watch an ad. Also: 1. Non-optional little banner ads 2. Non-optional ad breaks, as well as 3. optional ads to play for essential extra space. These ads take away the flow and enjoyment of the game. Uninstalling.

Keeps crashing despite being updated. Originally it worked fine but then over the last few days it started to be really slow when starting a level to the point where it crashed. It appeared that after 3 crashes it would sort itself out but now it's crashed about 7 times despite me updating it. So frustrating and ready to uninstall.

Downright shameful. I purchased ad-free. Way too expensive, but fine. Supposed to be a one-time buy. A few months later, I got a new phone. There's a button on the game, 'restore purchases', which doesn't work. So I contact their support. Weeks long conversations. They want proof of payments, to know my progress and more. Then I'm promised it'll be refunded as they admit it's not possible to restore purchases. I'm now told after that promise that they can't refund. So don't bother.

Enjoyed it before; love it now with the additional goals of ice and wood. Not knowing which way the piles will flip is frustrating, but the game is still fun. A MAJOR annoyance is that if you lose a level, there's no way to return to the main menu... so I can't watch an ad to get the 15 minutes of unlimited lives without closing and reopening the app.

I get ads. I get the need for ads. Yes, an ad to start a round and then when you finish a round gets a bit annoying. HOWEVER, when you get a pop up IN THE MIDDLE of a round that says "Ad Break", that's way too much, especially when you're on a roll in a challenging round. Then, when it happens a second time IN THE SAME ROUND??!! For that reason alone - UNINSTALLED and one star!

After the last heart goes, I'm on never ending loop of "out of lives" "are you sure you want to quit?" Screen. I cross one and other pops up and there's no home option so I have to close the app entirely. Also, this app drains the battery very quick. Another thing is I wish I could choose where the hexagon flips, it is random so strategy doesn't really work so it's pure luck. However, I like the concept of the game and game play is smooth.
